meanings.definition: A gallery or arcade above the nave of a church, opening onto the nave and aisles.
meanings.sent1: The triforium in the church allowed visitors to view the nave from above.
meanings.sent2: The sunlight streamed through the triforium, illuminating the beautiful architecture.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons found a cozy spot in the triforium, enjoying the view of the church below.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts echoed in her mind like whispers in the triforium of a cathedral.
meanings.sent5: The triforium resembled a secret passageway, hidden high above the church.

meanings.definition: A triforium is a shallow arched gallery within the thickness of an inner wall, above the nave of a church.
meanings.sent1: The ancient triforium displayed intricate carvings along its walls.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the detailed artwork adorning the triforium of the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat climbed up to the triforium, pretending to be a royal guard.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams floated like ethereal clouds in the vast triforium of her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The triforium seemed like a hidden treasure trove, waiting to be explored.
